tasks.title: Initialize ESP-IDF v5.x project structure
tasks.description: Set up the complete ESP-IDF project with CMake configuration, component structure, and build system
tasks.details: Create root CMakeLists.txt with include($ENV{IDF_PATH}/tools/cmake/project.cmake), set up main component with entry point, configure sdkconfig.defaults with CONFIG_FREERTOS_HZ=1000, CONFIG_ESP_MAIN_TASK_STACK_SIZE=8192. Create idf_component.yml for dependency management.

tasks.title: Configure partition table with LittleFS
tasks.description: Create custom partition table with dedicated LittleFS partition for pattern storage
tasks.details: Create partitions.csv with: nvs (0x9000, 24KB), otadata (0xF000, 8KB), app0 (0x11000, 1.5MB), app1 (0x181000, 1.5MB), prismfs data 0x82 (0x2F1000, 1MB). Set CONFIG_PARTITION_TABLE_CUSTOM=y in sdkconfig.defaults.
tasks.testStrategy: Run idf.py partition-table to verify partition layout; ensure prismfs partition is correctly sized at 1MB

tasks.title: Add LittleFS managed component
tasks.description: Integrate joltwallet/littlefs as managed component using ESP-IDF Component Manager

tasks.testStrategy: Check managed_components/joltwallet__littlefs exists; verify CMake finds the component

tasks.title: Implement core filesystem operations (prism_fs)
tasks.description: Create filesystem abstraction layer with LittleFS mounting, atomic operations, and index management
tasks.details: Implement prism_fs_init() with esp_vfs_littlefs_register(), format_if_mount_failed=true. Create atomic commit pattern: write to .tmp file, fsync, rename. Implement index operations using cJSON for metadata storage at /prism/.index.json.

- Implement prism_fs_init() using esp_vfs_littlefs_register() with format_if_mount_failed=true; ensure /prism and subdirs exist.
- Implement atomic commit pattern: write to path.tmp, fsync, close, rename to final.
- Implement index management at /prism/.index.json using cJSON; load on boot, persist on updates.
- Add error propagation using core error codes and logging.
- Add Unity tests for mount/unmount, create/rename/delete, atomic rename.

- Add hex encoding utility for 32/64-byte digests.
- Add Unity tests using NIST vectors; verify streaming vs single-shot equality.

tasks.title: Implement binary file format parser for .prism files

tasks.details: Validate .prism format magic bytes 'PRISM\x00\x00\x00', version check, CRC32 header verification. Implement safe TLV parser with: bounds checking, maximum length validation, safe memory allocation. Support record types 0x0001-0x0005. This handles the .prism format (device runtime format), not the .k1p legacy format.

Create robust .prism parser under storage:

- Implement safe TLV iterator with max lengths, overflow checks, and allocation limits.
- Parse required TLVs into a PatternMeta struct (uuid, duration, palette refs, etc.).
- Integrate CRC32 from prism_hash and error codes.
- Add fuzz-ish unit tests for malformed headers, oversized TLVs, corrupted CRC.
- Document on-disk constraints for future writers.

tasks.title: Implement structural efficiency optimizations
tasks.description: Optimize .prism format size through structural efficiency: shared palettes, delta encoding, and hot cache
tasks.details: Focus on structure-first approach rather than algorithm compression. Implement: (1) Shared palette system - reuse color palettes across patterns to reduce duplication, (2) Delta encoding for timeline keyframes - store differences between frames instead of absolute values, (3) Hot cache for frequently used patterns - keep popular patterns in RAM. Consider Heatshrink/gzip compression as optional later enhancement, not primary strategy. Target: reduce typical pattern size by 40-60% through structural efficiency alone.
tasks.testStrategy: Create test patterns with repeated palettes and verify sharing reduces file size; test delta encoding produces correct playback; benchmark hot cache hit rates
tasks.expansionPrompt:
Add structure-first size reductions spanning parser and compiler-side assumptions:
- Define shared palette table model in PatternMeta and resolve palette deduplication by ID/reference.
- Implement delta encoding for keyframes in pattern_format.c with helper to reconstruct absolute frames.
- Add RAM hot cache (LRU of N decoded patterns) in storage/cache_manager.c.
- Extend .prism TLV schema to carry palette refs and delta-coded frames; guard with versioning.
- Add tests verifying round-trip decode correctness and size improvements on synthetic patterns.
- Provide metrics hooks to report hit rate and average compressed sizes.

tasks.title: Implement memory pool manager to prevent heap fragmentation
tasks.description: Create fixed-size memory pools at startup for all dynamic allocations to prevent heap fragmentation that causes device failure within 12-48 hours
tasks.details: Implement a memory pool manager in firmware/components/core/memory_pool.c that pre-allocates fixed-size pools during system initialization. Create three pool sizes: POOL_4KB (4096 bytes) for WebSocket frames (based on WS_BUFFER_SIZE=8192 in sdkconfig.defaults), POOL_1KB (1024 bytes) for HTTP headers and small buffers, and POOL_256B (256 bytes) for messages and control structures. Use heap_caps_malloc(size, MALLOC_CAP_INTERNAL | MALLOC_CAP_8BIT) during initialization to allocate pool memory. Implement pool structures with free lists using atomic operations (portENTER_CRITICAL/portEXIT_CRITICAL). Create prism_pool_alloc(size_t size) to return appropriate pool block, prism_pool_free(void *ptr) for returns. Add pool statistics tracking: allocations, frees, current usage, high water mark, and failed allocations. Initialize pools in system_init() before any component initialization. Replace all dynamic allocations after init with pool allocations. Add compile-time assertion to prevent malloc/free usage post-init using __wrap_malloc and __wrap_free linker wrapping. Pool sizes: 8 blocks of 4KB (32KB total), 16 blocks of 1KB (16KB total), 32 blocks of 256B (8KB total) = 56KB reserved heap.
tasks.testStrategy: Create unit tests to verify pool initialization allocates exactly 56KB from heap. Test allocation/free patterns: allocate all blocks, verify failure on N+1, free all, reallocate. Run stress test with rapid alloc/free cycles for 72 hours monitoring heap_caps_get_free_size() to verify zero fragmentation. Test WebSocket frame allocation uses 4KB pool. Verify malloc() calls after init trigger assertion failure. Monitor pool statistics during 48-hour runtime, verify no failed allocations under normal load. Use heap_caps_check_integrity_all() every hour to detect corruption. Benchmark allocation speed vs direct malloc (target <10% overhead).

tasks.title: Create heap monitoring system with fragmentation detection
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive heap monitoring system that tracks memory health every second, detects fragmentation, and provides early warning for memory-related failures
tasks.details: Create a dedicated heap monitoring component in firmware/components/core/heap_monitor.c with header prism_heap_monitor.h. Implement heap_monitor_init() to initialize monitoring structures and start a FreeRTOS task with 3KB stack at priority tskIDLE_PRIORITY+2. The monitoring task should run every second using vTaskDelayUntil() for precise timing. Track metrics: current free heap via esp_get_free_heap_size(), minimum free heap via esp_get_minimum_free_heap_size(), largest contiguous block via heap_caps_get_largest_free_block(MALLOC_CAP_8BIT), and calculate fragmentation percentage as ((free_heap - largest_block) * 100) / free_heap. Implement critical thresholds: HEAP_CRITICAL_MIN (50KB), HEAP_WARNING_MIN (75KB), LARGEST_BLOCK_MIN (20KB), FRAGMENTATION_WARNING (30%), FRAGMENTATION_CRITICAL (50%). Create alert system using ESP_LOGW for warnings and ESP_LOGE for critical states. Track all task stack high-water marks by iterating through tasks using uxTaskGetSystemState() and calling uxTaskGetStackHighWaterMark() for each task handle. Log stack usage for tasks approaching limits (<512 bytes remaining). Store metrics in circular buffer (last 60 samples) for trend analysis. Implement heap_monitor_get_stats() API to return current metrics structure. Add heap integrity checking using heap_caps_check_integrity_all() every 10 seconds in debug builds (CONFIG_HEAP_POISONING_LIGHT enabled in sdkconfig.defaults). Replace the basic heap_monitor_task in main.c with this comprehensive monitoring system. Add compile-time option CONFIG_HEAP_MONITOR_ENABLE to sdkconfig.defaults. Include performance counter to track time spent in monitoring (target <1ms per cycle). Create heap_monitor_dump_stats() to output detailed report including per-task stack usage, heap trends, and fragmentation history. Integrate with system error handler to dump heap stats on crash.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify monitoring task starts and runs without impacting system performance (<1ms overhead). Test threshold detection by allocating/freeing memory to trigger each alert level. Confirm fragmentation calculation by creating deliberate fragmentation pattern (allocate mixed sizes, free alternating blocks) and verify percentage matches expected value. Test stack monitoring by creating test task with known stack size, fill stack with pattern, verify high-water mark detection. Run 72-hour stability test monitoring all metrics, verify no memory leaks in monitor itself. Test alert system triggers at exact thresholds (50KB, 20KB largest block). Verify circular buffer correctly stores 60 samples and wraps properly. Test heap integrity checking detects deliberate corruption in debug build. Benchmark monitoring overhead stays under 1ms per second. Verify dump_stats output includes all tracked metrics in readable format. Test integration with existing heap_monitor_task replacement in main.c.

tasks.title: Implement bounds checking utilities for all input validation
tasks.description: Create comprehensive safe buffer handling utilities with macros for secure memory operations, preventing buffer overflows and crashes through rigorous validation of all size parameters before operations.
tasks.details:
Implement prism_secure.h/c in firmware/components/core/ with critical safety utilities:

1. Safe memory operations:
- SAFE_MEMCPY(dst, src, size, max_size) - validates size <= max_size before memcpy
- SAFE_STRNCPY(dst, src, max_len) - ensures null termination, prevents overflow
- SAFE_MEMMOVE(dst, src, size, max_size) - bounds-checked memmove
- BOUNDS_CHECK(ptr, offset, size, max) - validates pointer arithmetic safety

2. WebSocket frame validation (per websocket_protocol.md):
- ws_validate_frame_length(length) - check against 8192 byte maximum
- ws_validate_tlv_bounds(type, length, payload_ptr, frame_end) - ensure TLV doesn't exceed frame
- ws_validate_session_id(id) - prevent integer overflow in session tracking

3. Pattern file validation:
- pattern_validate_header_size(size) - check header bounds before parsing
- pattern_validate_chunk_offset(offset, chunk_size, file_size) - prevent read beyond EOF
- pattern_validate_filename(name, max_len) - sanitize and length check

4. Array access safety:
- SAFE_ARRAY_INDEX(array, index, size) - returns NULL if out of bounds
- SAFE_BUFFER_APPEND(buf, data, len, buf_size) - atomic append with overflow check
- CIRCULAR_INDEX(index, size) - safe wraparound for ring buffers

5. String operations:
- safe_strlen(str, max_len) - bounded string length
- safe_strcmp(s1, s2, max_len) - bounded comparison
- safe_atoi(str, result, min, max) - parse with range validation

6. Integer overflow protection:
- SAFE_ADD(a, b, result) - check for overflow before addition
- SAFE_MUL(a, b, result) - check for multiplication overflow
- SIZE_T_MAX_CHECK(size) - validate against platform limits

All macros should use static inline functions for type safety and include ESP_LOGE logging on violations. Functions return esp_err_t with ESP_ERR_INVALID_SIZE on bounds violations. Critical functions marked IRAM_ATTR for interrupt context safety.
tasks.testStrategy:
Create test_bounds_checking.c with comprehensive unit tests:
1. Test each macro with valid inputs, boundary cases, and overflow attempts
2. Verify WebSocket frames >8192 bytes are rejected
3. Test TLV parsing with malformed lengths that exceed frame boundaries
4. Simulate buffer overflow attempts with oversized memcpy operations
5. Verify all safety checks log errors via ESP_LOGE
6. Test circular buffer wraparound with CIRCULAR_INDEX
7. Verify integer overflow detection in SAFE_ADD/SAFE_MUL
8. Run stress test with fuzzer generating random invalid inputs
9. Memory leak check with heap_caps_check_integrity_all()
10. Verify no performance regression (<1% overhead) in critical paths
